solution_line_template: The number of male employees is {total_employees} * {male_fraction} = <<{total_employees}*{male_fraction}={male_employees}>>{male_employees}.
So, the number of female employees is {total_employees} - {male_employees} = <<{total_employees}-{male_employees}={female_employees}>>{female_employees}.
The number of female employees who are not moms is {female_employees} - {non_mother_women} = <<{female_employees}-{non_mother_women}={female_mother_employees}>>{female_mother_employees}.
So the amount to be distributed to each mother would be ${total_bonus_pool} / {female_mother_employees} = $<<{total_bonus_pool}/{female_mother_employees}={bonus_per_mother}>>{bonus_per_mother}.
